alert.note: Alert for Covington; Jones (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 5:05PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Covington and Jones Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 504 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Laurel to near Seminary. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Laurel, Ellisville, Collins, Sandersville, Soso, Seminary, Moselle, Eastabuchie, Ovett, Mill Creek, Sanford, Tuckers Crossing, Hebron and Moss. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for south central, central, southeastern and east central Mississippi.
